caption: We’ve ordered now multiple times from different services including GrubHub and Uber eats. Last time I found a dish that I loved in the Chicken Piccata. It was acidic, well balanced buttery, white wine sauce with just the right amount of capers. So, I ordered two tonight to have leftovers for lunch for a few days. What I got was some sort of Frankenstein amalgamation of Chicken Piccata and spaghetti marinara. Either the cook had no freaking clue what he was doing in the kitchen, or decided this order came in too close to closing time ahead of their day off and wasn’t worth investing the time to make a good white wine sauce. So, they pan fried a chicken breast in butter, lemon, and capers and then dumped it on top of a soaghetti marinara. The entire point of me ordering this was not wanting a tomato based entree. I’ve requested a refund for both orders of the chicken piccata.

Their Italian takeout pivot during Covid is AWESOME. Chicken Parm is awesome, as is the gnocchi, chicken piccata, cheesy garlic bread and the sneaky fantastic garlic broccoli appetizer. Everyone misses the mussels and frites (rightly so) but man I’ll miss their Italian menu whenever covid is through and they return to their normal menu. Their takeout Parms are keeping us sane at home through Covid!
This is a must-have stop while in DC, especially on a chilly night out with friends.
Cozy spot with great Belgian food/drinks.

This place used to have an amazing brunch. They used to have amazing mussels, or prok belly grits with maple syrup. My favorite was the bison brisket with a poached egg over truffle fries. Sad that this place is Italian pasta now. Will never go back.
Fantastic local restaurant and bar! Great food and excellent staff. Beef stew, gnocchi, sandwiches, and poutine are full of flavor and amazing!
Awesome Belgian mussels, fries and beer!!!
Awesome
Good mussels on Monday!!!
Incredible mussels and Belgian beer. Friendly staff and talented cooks
Hidden gem! Walked past this place 100x and a friend of mine pointed it out.  Came in for mussels, frites, and beer.  Bartenders were also super friendly and attentive.  Will definitely be back!
Exceptional food, very friendly staff members, consistently  awesome character. They charge affordable pricing and the food quality is excellent. Great work.
Great selection of Belgian beers and great, helpful, and friendly staff.
Great little pub atmosphere. We loved the Belgian gnocchi and the fried cheese starters. Good size portions. Great beers
Great cheeseburger and craft beers! Delicious!
The meals and service were ahead of my expectations. I absolutely enjoyed the environment of this place. Excellent place to take my family out for lunch.
A hidden gem of H St. Very traditional Belgian restaurant that is a great place to hunker down and have Belgian beer with some of the best Mussels I've ever had!
Poutine was to die for, as was the beer menu.
Awesome dive bar with really high quality,  well priced food.  Huge beer list and I've never liked muscles before trying them here haha
Noisy

Went to Granville after The Pug was in cleanup mode after the H Street Festival. Had to watch Liverpool FC at 10 AM in the morning! Great Belgian beers and the 'Belgian' Reuben was excellent. Good Belgian fries with mayo as is tradition.

One of the OGs of the H street restaurant crowd, we have been visiting this Belgium spot for years and years. The beer selection is fantastic and the food is always solid. The decor is fairly basic with low lighting and feels like a neighborhood spot. There are fancier restaurants in the H street corridor but not too many better meals.
Mussels, frites, excellent beer.  HH for local brews.
Beer and frites
Great food,  great beer  selection, great service.

We had a great meal. We showed up on a Saturday night with no reservation. They were super accommodating and found us a table upstairs. We had one person with a very specific food allergy, 2 kids, and one adult who just wanted to order off the kids menu. They took care of all of us, everyone enjoyed their food, and the waiter made a great beer recommendation to go with my mussels.
Great drinks. Learn who Mr Granville was and each time you buy a drink you'll feel like you're giving back to that community. Don't forget about the fresh mussels!!

I ventured out and tried the Bleu Mussels, which were delicious! I also ordered the poutine and it was served slightly warm- I mentioned it to our server and he had it completely remade.  Outstanding customer service here!!
The ambience is really cool. The Marguerite (their own spin on Margarita) was very good and strong. Customer service was on point as well
Great beers, good food, friendly staff
Wow! Great service, amazing mussels. Highly recommend the bleu and champignons. Two-three people can share a side of frites.
A great spot....and if you go there enough they know your name
Super crew, great food.
Looks uncomfortable dark.and cramped
Good food. Nice waitress. Drinks took forever (halfway into out meal) and the Virgin drink we ordered for a pregnant woman had vodka in it. Mgmt and bar staff disappointing. Wait staff was just fine.
Mussels great... the other food just ok
(Translated by Google) Good place to see the shempioooooooons!  (Original) Buen lugar para ver la shempioooooooons!
The mussels there are amazing.
Great bagels and beverages good service!
Only been there once but the $12 mussels are really worth it and they have an amazing selection of beers.
Delicious food. Yum, yum, yum. Incredible beer list. Great service! I look forward to returning.
Great place
Too salty

I absolutely love the atmosphere and the food is amazing. The bar tender girl (i forget her name) along with the rest of the staff are so sweet and accommodating. Definitely a cozy place to unwind, watch some tv, have a beer and eat some comfort food. And they weren't kidding when they said they have the best muscles in DC.

Best place in DC for mussels. They are so good! They have a bunch of different types of broths you can get your mussels in. Get a side of french fries that are incredible as well. They have different flavors of sauces to dip the fries in. The beer selection is fantastic and unique! Love this place

The mussels were very tasty.  Decent beer selection.  The service was reasonably prompt with a "just the facts" kind of interaction.  The seating was cramped.  I don't regret going, but I don't plan on going back either.
Fantastic blue cheese and bacon mussels. We go here whenever we are in DC.
Best mussels I've had in DC. Great selection of Belgian beers
Burgers are great and nice selection of beer.
It was a friend's choice. It was ok.
These 👏 mussels 👏
Good service. Good, but limited  menu. Lots of excellent Belgian beers.

Love this place. The mussels are their specialty, but I love the burger and chicken wings. Great beer selection and if you like lambics you should go here. Also, just a nice neighborhood spot; laidback and everyone is nice.

Granville Moore's is a somewhat hidden, but well-known H Street spot for mussels and beers in a quaint but distinguished building. There's a reason GM's is known as having the best mussels in DC, and the beer selection is fantastic as well. We went to GM's for Mussel's Monday, which offers $12 mussel servings. Here's what we had:  GM's offerings for their top pairing of food - mussels and frites - is supplemented with their creative sauces for each. We ordered the Mariniere, Spicy Thai Curry, and Chowder to get the full range of tastes. Our group was impressed by the creativity of the spicy thai curry, the hearty chowder, but the back-to-basics mariniere show's why this place is the best place to get mussels in dc.  Don't sleep on the delicious frites either, because they have their own set of creative sauces too. Truffle mayo, dijonnaise, chiptole mayo, SAMURAI SAUCE, horseradish, and curry mayo. They're the perfect compliment to the mountains of mussels you'll be consuming.  You can't go wrong with their beer selection, so here's my only recommendation: The DC Brau Doctor's Dubbel. It's the house beer and only available at Granville Moore's!
Really cozy place with great beer and good food. Mussel Monday has delicious steamed mussels for $12 (normally $19). Will be back!

Vast collection of beers with a specialty in belgian, coupled with great food. This place has a "pub" feel to it. The fries and wings are worth getting, and the mussels are clearly a hit. Reservations for dinner get busy, so I recommend hitting up bar space earlier rather than later.
Good food, drinks and experience!
Best mussels in DC.

Delicious mussels, terrible service, inedible dessert.  Wow, has this once-excellent restaurant declined. Our indifferent server brought our group's  dinners and sides at different times, then ignored both our empty water glasses and our repeated requests that they be refilled. She never checked back to see if we were enjoying our meals and if we wanted anything else. The restaurant was not busy,  so there was no valid excuse for her ignoring us - though there was an explanation.  She was so busy chatting up the bartender, she apparently didn't have time for the tables she was supposed to tend.  Mussels and fries were delicious. Steak was mediocre. Waffle dessert was inedible. It tasted rancid, and 3 of our party who tasted it spit it out in their napkin. Our server did not seem to notice or care that 5 people only touched 3 forkfuls of dessert. Given her demonstrated lack of interest in customer service, we didn't waste our breath complaining.
Good date spot
Best mussels in DC! Great local restaurant with awesome food and beer! Different specials every night and you have to get the mussels if you go! Belgium style.
Excellent beer selection - amazing mussels and fries!!
Awsome brunch.  I had the corn beef hash which was awesome and enough for 2 meals.
Ok belgian food but there are better places in bethesda and the palisades.

Cool spot on H street. I really enjoy the atmosphere inside. Delicious mussels and french fries! The beer selection is good. They have belgian beers and belgian style beers on draft. The beers are a little expensive (most drafts were over $10) but this is reasonable for what you are getting ( e.g. beers from outside the US and sours). A good experience overall
Nice beer selection and their mussels and fries are amazing.

Some truly delicious hearty Belgium food. The Brussel Sprouts with lardons were my favorite. Ordered an old-fashioned, which was not amazing (my fault, not really a cocktail place) but was enough drink for me for the whole night :) The beer options looked outstanding, and some day I will learn to love beer.

This quaint little bar is 5 stars all the way .  Mussels are the name of the game.  Chowder and Thai style are the must orders.  Double cooked fries are super crispy.  The wings are Smokey and just a little spicy.  Incredible beer list. Date night or friends and family night , great spot.  Can't wait to be back.
Delicious mussels and fries and an extensive beer list. Not much seating inside so make a reservation especially if you have more than four people.

A regular destination.  Particularly on Mussel Mondays where the delightful bivalve is discounted.  Amazing fries (frites) with a wide selection of dipping sauces.  Likewise there is always an array of mussel preparations and I've never had one I didn't like.  The classic Bleu is a standout.  Don't be afraid to tip that bowl up to drink down all the amazing broth.
Cozy, hip, and delicious. The thing to get here is a seasonal beer and one of their divine bowls of mussels.
Great little bar.  They played Home Alone on the TV. They deserve a 5.
Great Belgian beer selection!   Not a robust menu,  but very cultivated.   The Cassoulet was fabulous!   Chicken & sausage with white beans & pork belly.  Yum!
Great mussels dishes and decent tap menu.

We first came here after I saw it featured on "Throwdown With Bobby Flay", and it's been a regular visit for my family since. The food is always excellent (if not a bit heavy) the beer selection is great (even if I always get Saison du Pont, which goes excellently with mussels), but the service can be a little slow at times.  Highlights: beer selection, bleu cheese mussels, frites

Eat all of the mussels! The Bleu cheese and pork belly one was unique and amazing! The smoked grilled wings are charred to perfection! I've never had a reuben on a roll before but I'm in love now, so tender and the red kraut was really tangy. My sister had the corned beef has and it looked so good. She said it was. Lots of beers to chose from, and the staff was spot on with their recommendations. Jason did a wonderful job keeping up with our 8 top. Would definitely make this a repeat stop when my wife and I come back.
Only stopped in for a drink but really enjoyed it. Very friendly bartender and lively atmosphere. Will definitely go back!

Low key atmosphere good beer selection and mussels are delicious.  Other food options are delicious as well. One of the first restaurants in the revitalized H street corridor.  Not great for large groups, but can accommodate upstairs.
Always go with the mussels.
Awesome selection of unique Euro drafts. Frites were good and don't break the bank. Has a nice cozy atmosphere
Nice cozy place. Good beer list, albeit a little spendy. Mussels were outstanding!
Everything here is great!
Double angus burger was awesome.

We are from out of state and decided to stop and give this place some business. We were greeted with a rude batender slamming our orders on the bar and making us feel dumb because we didn't know where to look for the draft list. Will not come back. Plenty of other great places to go on the strip. Do yourself a favor a skip this place on your night out. You have been warned.

Went on a recommendation from our AirBnB hosts.  A great neighborhood bar where you have your choice of amazing beers on draft and tasty menu options.  The bartender was a great guy who gave us out-of-towners recommendations on breweries (Atlas Brew Works) and how to get there (don't walk!).

The beer is a bit expensive (except for the house dubbel by DC Brau, which is quite good) but the food is incredible. The pub food is some of the best on H St. I haven't had the mussels yet but from what I understand they're the star of the show. I'll update once I've had them
Stopped here for dinner and beer and this place did not disappoint! The beer on tap was a great selection (small selection but varied so there was something for everyone) and the food was amazing.
One of my all time favorite DC bar/restaurants.

Got there and were lucky there was room at the bar. All other tables were reservation only. We ended up just ordering beers and some mussels. The mussels were tasty, although I’m  not sure I got the flavor I actually ordered. Didn’t give this place 5 stars as the bartender didn’t have much time for you unless you knew exactly what you wanted and really didn’t seem to care what you thought once you got it.
Neat atmosphere.  They have great beers and the food is excellent
Delicious mussels and great beer selection

Hands down the best mussels in town. You certainly wouldn't know it passing by on the street, but I think they like it that way to keep the crowds at bay. The french fries are low key fantastic too, and they have one of the better beer selections you'll find in the city. These three things alone make it not just a must-visit but a new city favorite.  That said, their overall dinner menu is definitely limited. They know what they do best and they don't stray far from that path.
Great spot!
Great food

Pretty good spot, a little dingy but that's the bar atmosphere they are going for I think. We got the original mussels which were pretty good, average flavor. We also got the Mac and cheese gnocchi, those were great! Super cheesy and rich deliciousness
Service was lovely and food delicious!

I really feel the vibe of this place and I enjoy it immensely, it’s the number one spot I’ve visited on H st since being in DC for the past 4 years. I’m going to post this review with a single issue related to the mussels that they tout as the best running for 10 years in DC. It should not stop you from visiting, in fact, it should only encourage you to visit with the pretense that they will read this review and do something about it so that they go for another decade.  Mussels are like the milk to my cereal. I love them, I feel nirvana when I eat good ones, I often daydream about harvesting them from mudflats. I recognize how they are as particular as grapes regarding the area that they cluster and, as such, can take on distinct characteristics. On one occasion I ordered the mariniere; it was a Saturday brunch where I brought a group of guys. I was the only mussel fan among them so I had them all to myself. Here’s the thing, they were not worth talking about. They had a taste that I kept to myself, but I couldn’t tell if they had passed by the handoff to be kitchen or simply beyond their prime. Either way it was not a good batch and it makes me hope that the QC for their mussels will step up.  Otherwise great beer, fantastic staff, and a phenomenal recipe for even the basic frites. They’ve etched themselves into a, hopefully, permanent corner of the neighborhood

Very divey feel to this place.  Feels like there are roaches just under the frayed wood, which made it hard to enjoy the food.  Friendly service and I enjoyed my beer.  The mussels and fries were good, but not amazing.

This is that rare spot that looks and feels like a hole-in-the-wall but has top-tier food. My wife and I came here for dinner before catching a show at the Atlas Performing Arts Center. The place was a bit tricky to find, but it was exactly what we were after: great food, well-groomed beer selection, and good atmosphere.  The steak was perfectly prepared, the crab cakes were meaty, and the portions were generous. I didn't try the mussels, but I wish I had. I recommend making reservations if you want to sit at a table; most of the space is reserved for the downstairs and upstairs bars, both of which were filling up by 6:30pm.
Loved the food, mussels were amazing. Staff was nice even when my parents were struggling to speak English

I enjoyed a brunch with scrambled eggs, avocado and cheese with fritos on an English muffin. This was really tasty although I felt the fritos were a bit greasy. A selection of German beers were available, but I enjoyed a cider.

It's a little claustrophobic inside. Don't let that turn you away. The food is better than the internal structure would have you think.  The beer selection is very good.  If you like mussels-- this is where you wanna be. If you don't like mussels-- well, as stated above-- the beer selection is very good. I'm not saying the other food is bad (the wings were above par)-- but the mussels are what's worth talking about.
Great Food and Awesome Beers
Great bartender!!
Great food & atmosphere. Get the burger and have a beer.

This place is one of the few bars thats carries my favorite belgian beer , La Choufee. The beer was delicious, and we also ordered the frites and mussels. The frites were good, we ordered the curry mayo and the truffle mayo to go with it. The curry mayo was great, the truffle mayo, despite being the most popular, wasn't my favorite. We ordered the classic mussels and they were good. It was a pretty large portion and it came with a pretty decent amount of bread. Overall, I would definitely visit again
Great food. Great beer. Small but cozy. Must try

My husband and I tried this place at a friend's recommendation. We really liked the wings appetizer, as well as our beers. We thought the mussels were okay, but not as good as some other places we've been. We ordered the frites, and while they were good, they were not served with the sauces that we ordered (and they were supposed to come with). My mussels were supposed to have sausage in the sauce and there was none in the entire pot. Our waiter tried to point out the sausage to me, putting his finger close to my food (pointing out mushrooms not sausage) and poured beer all over my foot. Overall, we did not enjoy the experience and will stick with our favorite places for mussels.

1 star because there's no option for 0 stars. We asked for our food to be cooked a certain way and the waiter said no. After publicly mocking us with the bartender, the bartender told us the kitchen is too busy to cook a cheeseburger the way we wanted it.
One of my favs, fresh delish mussels, great Belgium beers, friendly staff!  A DC must do!
Great mussels, burgers, fries and brews
Amazing mussels, great beer.

Friendly, knowable service. Food was definitely above average considering they label it pub food, although the frites are too salty. Interesting beer selection. But it’s too pricey. We had two entrees and two beers and paid $75 incl tax&tip.
gem of h st, fantastic mussels and specials
They offer nice and Hearty brunch
The chicken and waffles were awesome, so much food.

username: m i c h a e l

caption: Hands down the best mussels ever! I always get the Bleu..  mussels cooked up with blue cheese, white wine, onions, pork belly and lemon. Yum-my! The Spicey Thai Curry is delish too... what am I talking about?... all the mussels are delicious! I’m not a beer drinker but they do have a huge beer selection. My husband and friends are always raving about it. The only reason I’m not giving this place five stars is because of the cleanliness or lack there of. It’s not horrible, just not the tidiest.
The mussels and the beer menu are on point. Also, surprisingly, the best veggie burger I've had in my life

Honestly one of my favorite places on H st. great food and usually good service. Not sure I am a huge fan of there new habit of  giving you time limits on how long you can stay and eat when you walk in the  door.
Mussels and Fries!  are awesome!  My friend had the bison burger and it looked very good!  Will be back to try it.
Great find. Impressive beer list and food is amazing.
So fun

Great selection of beer and awesome food. I highly recommend the Bleu mussels and the burgers. Also, the Doctor’s wings are phenomenal and the staff is great. I have been going here since 2012 and I have never had a bad meal. The staff is also very friendly.
Great food!
Always great quality cuisine and service.
Known for mussels but the gastropub serves great food and specials.  Brussel sprouts are delicious
Great service and ambiance. Parking is a beach though
A dive bar accurately describes this place if you like a neighborhood, cozy, dark place to grab a drink or a steamy mussel pot this is your place on H Street.
Best mussels in the area and lots of good Belgian beer
Great food 👍 the burger was amazing
The food was amazing. Service was a bit uneven, but we'll be back.

I hate that I am ranking this a 1 Star ...  went to Granville Moore’s for the first time for date night with my boyfriend. We are always in search for great mussels after having an awesome experience with mussels in Maine.  I looked up places to try in the DC area and of course Granville Moore’s came up — so we made reservations for date night.  The food was delicious, the beer was awesome with an amazing selection to choose from.  We ordered the gnocchi Mac & cheese to start and shared two mussel bowls.  Both were very flavorful and amazing. As date night winded down — my boyfriend was signing the check when the LARGEST COCKROACH I’ve ever seen came scurrying down where table met the wall and made a beeline for me. Me not a fan of bugs in general and definitely not in a restaurant setting — yelped out and jumped out of our booth.  My boyfriend just wanting to bring attention to it to the waiter — alerted him.  The waiter just batted it off the table onto the floor near my boyfriends feet.  On our way out I alerted the hostess —more so that if she sat people there she was aware.  She immediately asked if “they took care of us” upstairs and that the owner was in the kitchen. My telling them wasn’t so that we could get comped... really just and FYI.  I’m sad to say that this was our first and last time we will eat there. Even sadder as the mussels were so freaking good but makes me wonder where else those cockroaches have crawled around. Bittersweet experience :(
always dependable for good food, especially the mussels and mac and cheese with pork belly
Awesome place for craft beers
Food and beer are really good. "Mid renovation" decor is ok. But the urine / ammonia smell by the restrooms and up the stairs is very off-putting.

This place is totally over-rated. Management apparently changed. The waiters/waitresses don't recognize you - even you have been there like three-four times a week. [OK. I am from Belgium and I moved to H-Street DC just three weeks ago - back from Afghanistan and Nepal - but so this was my frequency over the past three weeks.] I am old and bald, but I still get asked for an ID to check my age when I order a Belgian beer. I mean: I am an old Belgian, right? You should recognize one when you see one ! Just awful ! And then when you order moules-frites, you just get a handful of moules and over-cooked and over-salted frites (the kitchen doesn't know you should just dip fries twice in the oil to give that golden color - instead, they just keep it in). Well.... In short, for a Belgian, it's just a disaster. I will just walk over to the Mexican place across the street and have great food and booze from another cultural zone for a fraction of the price. So... In short, don't go for the great Belgian/French/European moules-frites experience at Granville Moore's. There must be other places. Maybe I should start one. JL

GM's food was just okay. I've been in the past and had a better experience. I shared the classic mussels and a bison burger with a friend. My service was lackluster and I didn't really feel appreciated as a customer.  My friend is in the food service industry and speculated that the server did the bare minimum because he didn't think we would tip well because of our order. Idk if that is true but I do know that is not the way to get repeat business.  DC has too many great food choices and experiences to settle for luke warm food, a watered down drink and grudging politeness. I won't be back.
Beer is awesome! I
Best Mussels around!  They offer great flavor options on for the Mussels.
Fries with sauce is my jam! Service kinda stand offish at the bar. No attempt to make small talk. Small but great beer selection.

Oh my! Second visit finally reviewing. The bar staff are fab - discussed what I was drinking, what I thought of it, then - unsolicited- made a great rec for my next one. Good brunch, even better mussels. The atmosphere is wonderful.
Really dark and the food was just ok. I don't get the hype about this place tbh
Mussels, frites and beer selection are a 4/5. Other menu items I've tried are a 3/5.
Their mussels are some of the best in the city.
Best "hole in the wall" in DC. Awesome food!
Been coming to this restaurant for years. Excellent moules and frites - right up there with the best in DC. Cool old rowhouse vibe and friendly staff, with an excellent Belgian beer selection.
Great mussles
Low lit, but also lit.
Mussels were great!!!
A+ for mussels and beer. Wish they had better non-mussel food items.

Had brunch there. Service was unhappy, depressed but efficient. Food was generally salty and below average.  Shrimp was a bit overcooked. Grits were too buttery.  Poached eggs were overdone and not runny.  Coffee was watered down and expensive.  Vegetarian sausage was too salty, over toasted and dry. Avocado was sprayed on the bun and hard to find. Fries were good, similar to five guy's fries.  Did not have the burger or the muscles. Generally unclean.  Water was dripping from ceiling onto dining table.  Place was super cold and uncomfortable.  The prices were high for quality provided.  Plenty other better places to spend your money at.

The mussels.....dear sweet lord ....the mussels at this place are incredible. Classic and Marinara are great takes on the usual recipe. But GM takes it to another level with the Bleu and Thai offering. Get the wings and gnocchi and bring an appetite.  I'd also agree with the reviews about beer prices, its a little steep, but you're paying for the quality and selection. And the service staff made great recommendations.

Was my first time since moving to H Street NE last year and it was ok. Got there when it opened, ate at the bar, had beer, wings, cauliflower, and split the brisket steak and cheese with fries and Thai mussels. Everything was really tasty, the stake and cheese was the only disappointment, seemed like very little meat and cheese on a huge roll, but was still tasty. Not cheap but not super expensive and was disappointed there were no HH specials but I'd definitely go back.
Mussels and fries are great. Too expensive. And the service was spotty. Also not very many gluten free options: only one type of mussels.
The mussels are very good, and they give generous portions of bread for soaking up the broth. Take note of the great beer selection as well.
Food and service were excellent.  Mussels and fries are particularly good.  Prices are a bit steep though.
Somewhat pricey, but the beer selection and food are pretty good. I had a good time while I was there, but there wasn't anything spectacular about the experience.
Great local spot with killer Belgian style beers.
Lots of people seem to like it, but I've always had rude service and mediocre deals at best
Service was a little slow to start. It the food was delicious. Just wish they served their mussels menu all day!
Great beer, amazing food, and amazing service!
Excellent moules frites with lots of great Belgian beer options. Reasonable prices for Belgian beer. The dining area is hip but cozy with exposed brick and wood. One of my favorite DC spots, period.
Granville Moore's is one of only two places that OES spectacular mussles in the district.
Great Belgian beer selection and good mussels
Hands down best burger and fries.
Great brunch but make a reservation first
I love this bar! Great beer selection, and reminds me of my study abroad experience in Brussels.

This is usually the second stop we take on H Street.  Both their tap and bottle list is impressive with many great Belgian and american beers.  The inside looks exactly like the typical bar you'd see in Belgium which is fantastic.  The fries are great as well which we always get with our beers as a late night snack.
Hands-down the BEST mussels in DC! Warm, cozy atmosphere with a great beer selection
Fantastic food and great, homey ambiance!
Great wait staff and the food is unique and fantastic
Good food, good beer.
You won't find better mussels even if you travel to Brussels plus a nice selection of Belgium style beer's.
Decent place. Prices were pretty decent.
Pricey but very good mussels.
Rodenbach on tap. Mussels with Thai seasoning and fresh onions. Frites with truffle mayo. Closest you can get to a Belgian restaurant without being in Belgium.
The beer is sour. 😀 And the service is on point.
Very good burger and frites. Beer selection is very strong Belgium wise.
Best place in the city for a beer or for the well known muscles and fritz
Love. Friendly staff, delectable dishes, great burgers, awesome beer selection and knowledgable bartenders! Music is on point!
Superb Belgian food.
This place had a great, unique beer selection. I've heard the food here was great but we only snacked on some fries. They were delicious and the dipping sauces provided a nice variety.
Great Belgian beer selection, and the bison burger is top notch.
This place probably has the best brunch food I've had in DC in two years. The pork belly and grits are literally fantastic. I could eat here every day, for real.
The beers on tap rotate every few days so its always a suprise.

The shrimp and grits here was probably one of the best brunches I've had since moving to DC last year. My companions were equally impressed with their eggs Benedict and the chicken and biscuit. Will gladly return.
Great drinks, great mussels I just love this place. Great for pre rock and roll hotel drinks and food, or anytime you find yourself on h street.

Worth a visit. Good beers and reasonably priced vino on Wednesday night. But the specialty is the mussels.  We tried several broths and the majority favored the mushroom based broth. Mussels were were very tender and fresh tasting, not "fishy". The funky relaxed and cozy environment adds to the appeal.

I went here last weekend for brunch based on the reviews, but my friend and I were terribly disappointed. The wait staff was friendly and accommodating and for that I give 2 stars, but the food was less than mediocre.  I love salt, but our fries and home fries were shockingly salty that we could barely eat them.  My friend ordered "THE GOOD DOCTOR scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, avocado, chipotle mayo on potato kaiser roll served with home frites"  He ate the fries (with a lot of water) and left the rest. He had added the smoked salmon to his order which was cold and covered in the chipotle mayo. The eggs were flavorless.  He also ordered the cinnamon rolls which were cold.  I had ordered the "CHICKEN & MUFFIN fried chicken breast, English muffin, sausage gravy, fried egg served with home frites"  The fried chicken was flavorless, the eggs tasteless and the biscuit was cold and dry - like something store-bought.  The gravy did have an intriguing flavor that reminded me of Middle Eastern food - and I am still trying to think of what the flavor was but it wasn't enough to save the meal. I did take it home so not to waste food and was able to salvage it by adding my own spices and ingredients, but what was served to us was not worth the $40.

Inexpensive food and drink with a focus on burgers and mussels.  Cool interior really adds to the atmosphere.  Rounding out the food and atmosphere was a solid beer selection offering multiple various types of sour ale both on draft and bottled

Fantastic food - portion sizes were plentiful, everything was quality product, and wonderfully flavorful.  Excellent service - quick with friendly, knowledgeable staff.  Quality of a fine dining restaurant, with the comfort of a local spot.  Tables are limited, though, so book/call ahead of time; otherwise, plan to sit at the bar.

The place seems to hide in plain site, but once you try it you'll never forget its location. I never thought of muscles as a food I'd crave at the end of a night out. This place has the most flavorful muscles I've had in the DMV and it's conveniently located next to an arcade bar. Treat yourself to a sour beer and the Mediterranean muscles after a long game of Mario Kart next door. Be sure to try their gnocchi starter as well!
Mussels and sour beer, great staff and a good vibe.

Heads up....ordered mussels...extremely huge dish for me. Asked to have it wrapped "to go."  Waitress stated restaurant does not allow mussels to be wrapped "to go" due to a health law hazard.   Felt bad to leave half of the enormous bowl of mussels.  Don't recall any disclosure stating this (maybe overlooked); but now you know.
Great prices and atmosphere!
If you enjoy these 3 things, you will love Granville Moore's: mussels, french fries, beer.

It is easy to overlook this place, with a mostly unmarked entrance from H Street. Even upon entering, seeing the 'rehab chic' dive bar aesthetic could have turned me away, but in my quest to eat at all the diners and dive bars within walking distance for weekend breakfast or brunch, I was drawn here. And for this, I am glad. The menu is fairly simple, but all of it looked delicious. I settled on a Maple pork belly and grits. Perfect comfort food for a cold morning in January.

Granville Moore's was written up in the New York Times so you know it's good. When you go in, the atmosphere is a little surprising, but adds to its charm. It's a small restaurant tucked away on H Street. It's very small and only has a few tables. It's dark and grungy inside, but it somehow works and is not off putting.  They are known for their mussels. My wife gets the seasonal mussels and the sauce is what makes it. They give you a basket of bread to dip in the sauce and it's so good (I don't like mussels, but oh man, that sauce). The mac and cheese is good and the fries are excellent (get the garlic ranch and/or the chipotle mayo to go with it).  The beer list is amazing. Every server is a beer expert (or at least comes across like it) and they always have specials. My favorite is a sour ale Duchesse de Bourgogne. It's amazing!  I'd go back to Grandville Moore's for sure!
It's known for mussels but I normally get the veggie burger. It's nice and crunchy around the edges. Top notch beer list too.
The shrimp and grits were delicious. I don't like their bloody marys, but they do make their own mix. Word of warning: this place is tiny. It is a dive bar that happens to have great brunch food.

We went there as tourists not expecting much except an good meal and drink. Great service started right on the doorstep. Since 1st floor was full we got offered to go eat on the 2nd floor at the bar where we met Will. He was very entertaining, we discussed many subjects and got great advice on food, drinks and even on the best spots to visit, during the day (and evenings). I discovered my new favorite beer over there (Will's favorite), even though I usually stick with spirits or cider (which they have). Food was great, we had plenty of fun. I will ensure to recommend this place to everyone I know who'll visit the capital.

If you like Belgium Beer and muscles then you would probably like this place.  However, I don't like beer and can't eat seafood.  I was not that happy with the steak, but the fries were good.  The menu is very limited, so check it before you go and see if it interests you.  For me the places doesn't really work.

I was starving and under the rain luckly i stumbled upon the tavern actually looking for another place... to my surprise this place was better than i expected. A wide variety of beers on tap and excellent cuisine. All plates have rich and tasty flavors in big quantities! Definitely coming back!
Love love love

This has to be one of the best brunch spots in DC. The vibe is chill, the food is amazing and the prices are great!! They make some of the best Bloody Marys around and their Good Doctor breakfast sandwich hits the spot.

Excellent belgian beer selection. However, I wish the beer was cheaper. Seating is hard to get on the weekends. I came with friends and we got burgers which were very good. I'd like to come back and try their mussel pots sometime.

I have always walked by Granville Moore but never stopped to see what it had to offer. I recently enjoyed dinner there on a Wedneday night and it was delicious. We ordered 2 different types (Marinere and Summer) of mussels and frites. Along with the mussels you receive bread (great for dipping into your mussel broth). With the frites we also chose different dipping sauces. Old bay ketchup and garlic mayo are my favorite so far!  I tried to return on a Saturday afternoon because I loved it so much, but unfortunately the kitchen wasn't opening till 5!  I will be returning and I would recommend this place to anyone!
Best place for beer brunch. Staff is always attentive, engaging, and knowledgeable. Food is excellent. It's become a go to brunch spot.

Moules and frites were decently good (not the best for the price) but the shrimp and grits were outstanding, the Belgian and Belgian-style beer list is excellent, the the ambiance (old-world dive bar inspired) was outstanding.  Definitely a spot to try if you are in the Atlas / H-street area.

I remember when Granville's opened way back and they had the best mussels I've ever had -- they actually were the ones to get me into and interested in mussels. I recently went again and wasn't completely blown away. I will say that all summer their mussels are $15, which is pretty awesome, but I didn't think they were the best ever (as they always win in DC). The beer selection is great, however, nothing is below $8 a beer. I'm sure I'll be back to Granville Moore's again, but it just might be after St Arnolds and Brasserie Beck first.
Has gone way downhill. $18 mussels the size of a pea? No thank you. These were happy hour (tiny) mussels at best and not worth $18.
Food was great and it's hard to beat their beer selection.

Very casual but hip atmosphere. You'll feel like you're in a college basement, but the moules and frites are the best around with large portions. Inventive dipping sauces, including old bay ketchup, are an added bonus to the already tasty fries. Believe it or not, I opted to try the Philly cheesesteak my last visit, and it was great. Huge selection of Belgian beers and others. Staff is very knowledgeable about their beer list and ready to make recommendations which is great for adventurous drinkers.
Great atmosphere, really enjoyed the Mussels, Frites & Bison Burgers...and even though I am not a big beer fan...appreciated the Belgian Beer.

Awesome mussels, great beer selection, and the best frites in the DC area.  On a more unpleasant note - A gratuity charge was added to our 5 person tab. It was a bit tacky on the part of the restaurant, and frankly a disservice to our waiter because we would have tipped more if that gratuity charge hadn't been included.  The service is hit and miss depending on whether it's busy, but it was decent on this occasion.  It's definitely worth the trip.

I have been wanting to eat at Granville Moore's for ages. Years, literally. I've heard nothing but praise for GM's, and I have to say, I was not impressed in the least. Upon arriving, we were whisked straight back to a closed-off closet without heat or insulation. There were four tables in this back "room" and every single person kept their coats on (and zipped) throughout the meal. With temps well below freezing outside it was brutal being forced to eat dinner in an ice cave. Everyone found it bizarre and irksome that the hostess didn't warn us of the space or give us the option to wait for a table in the main dining room at the bar. Where others found the space charming, we found it cramped and poorly managed. The only thing that lived up to expectation was the beer. GM's offers great seasonal variety, both by the bottle and on draught. Prices are a bit steep — $11 for a beer on H Street is borderline absurd. Mussels were salty, lacking true flavor, and all around unimpressive. One batch on our table reeked of gym socks — appetizing. Fries were fries, dipping sauces were dipping sauces (and far too salty). Again, what's so special about this place? Service was irritated, unhelpful, and downright rude. All of us left GM's dissatisfied and annoyed at how much we had to pay for the displeasure. It will be a long (if ever) time before we return.
Top-notch mussels and bartenders who know their Belgian brews. The place smells of butter and garlic as you walk in, and the atmosphere -- while dark -- is cozy. Love this place.

What's not to like/love about this place?   Probably the mice you see every now and then, but who really cares about mice? :)  This place ALWAYS has an amazing selection of good beers on tap and will ALWAYS have you leaving happy.  They can be pricey, but the price usually scales up with the alcohol content, if that matters to you.  Let's talk food, though.  There's really only one thing here that I ever eat but it's one of the best things I've ever eaten in DC.  It's their Frites...which for us normal folks means Fries, and they're OK if you order them that way.  These are grandmaw's fries.  Home fries.  Fries you'll fight a hobo for.  literally, they're that good.  We've made special stops here after nights ON H st just to make it in time before the kitchen closes just to get a taste of these babies.  So many sauces!  So much deliciousness!  You won't be left unhappy.  Oh, also come for the visuals.  This place is very rustic and very comfy to me.  It just feels...right.

If you are looking for the best mussels in DC...look no further. This place has so many options and flavors when it comes to mussel preparation that it would be hard to get tired of the cuisine. Also, the pomme frittes are MUST as a side. If the garlic salt parmesan sprinkles on them weren't reason enough, the accompanying SIX different dipping sauces should be. Again, I don't think you could get tired or overdo anything on this menu...and if you do, the belgian beer list should be more than plenty to keep you busy!
Food is pretty good. Stays pretty crowded most of the time though.
Mussels are good! They took my favorite thing (bison dish- not the burger) off the brunch menu- I probably won't be back :(
Tremendously comprehensive beer list, great mussels ans the apple hush puppies are amazing. You'll enjoy yourself here.

I've eaten moules frites (mussels and fries) all over France and the U.S, and can honestly say that this place has the best I've ever had.  Go to this place it's super reasonable and the food is fantastic.
Delicious and unpretentious
Mussels, baby.  Mussels.
Great, focussed menu. Mussels, bison, fries, Belgian beer.  Some other stuff, but if you hate those things, you're in the wrong place.  Fantastic quality!

This place is fantastic!  Knowledgable and passionate servers and bartenders, great atmosphere and wonderful patrons!  I'll admit it - I heard about it from Throwdown with Bobby Flay, and I wish that the truely unique atmosphere could be duplicated into a bigger place or even a second location, but because of the history behind the name and location, it would never be the same.  I had the Bleu Moulles; my wife had the classic version and liked mine better.  The beer was very expensive, but very good and arguably worth the 8 or 9 bucks that you'd pay for it.  Hey, if you'll pay 7 bucks for a Miller Lite at a ballgame, you should never complain about a $9 belgian brew from a place that knows what they're talking about!  Dr. Moore would be proud.
